fields.caption:
Left or right and why?

I'm a bit torn. I love them both, for different reasons.

It's amazing how different these two guitars are actually, when coming from such similar places, and sharing the same lines.
I know I'm maybe a little biased but I really love this guitar. Modern playability with a natural feel, and a resonant, vibrant and warm sound that works with what you give it.
This week's workshop diary is up on YouTube! Click the link in my bio, or swipe up on my story to see what I've been up to this week.

This one's going to Indonesia tomorrow to its owner, and the man that conceived the build, @limasenar

Thanks for trusting me with the commission man ‚ù§Ô∏è #moarguitarsforever

Family portrait ‚ù§Ô∏è #luthiery
#moarguitars

Right then guys! I think I've made enough of these, and they are different enough from the original, to warrant their own name, like my Wayfair, I need a name for my hollow or solid T's.

Got any ideas? .
.
#teletuesday #telecasterguitar #tstyleguitar #thinlinetele #hollowbodyguitar #boutiqueguitars #telecaster

Did you guys know that I wind all my own pickups? This gives me the flexibility to do more or less anything for each individual order, and each pickup is wound specifically for each customer (I don't have a massive stash of P90s) I wind each one with a specific player, guitar and tone in mind

They also sound really really good.

#pickupwinding #handwoundpickups #goldfoilpickups #boutiquepickups #guitartone

A couple of Wayfair foetuses caught in the wild.

Lots and lots and lots and lots and lots of sanding, carving and refining left to do... #moarwayfair #moarguitars #hollowbodyguitar #archtopguitar #fholes #carvedtopguitar #hollowbodybass

I've gotten quite a few orders for walnut guitars over the past few weeks, and I think this guitar is the culprit! It's a really really cool wood.

Dense, light and hard with beautiful grain and colour (that's what she said...) This guitar is about to go to its new owner in the states, will be exciting to see how it progresses..

I'm going to start a weekly workshop diary over on YouTube to show you guys some stuff from behind the scenes, and to document what goes on, and just have a bit of a chat... With myself.
Extremely high budget stuff.

Link in bio if you're interested!

This guitar is in need of a loving home, make me an offer via the reverb link in bio if you're interested! I've helped to smooth the process by dropping a little off the price üòâ

All specs are in the reverb ad üëç

#moarguitars

First photo of a new commission I was working on today. You can still see the chainsaw marks from carving the top.
Any guesses as to what it might be?

#moarguitarsforever

I know I posted this same guitar yesterday, but my god this thing plays well, so I decided it deserved a second day in the limelight.

I don't often get time (or maybe I don't often give myself time) to pause and enjoy when I'm testing a guitar, as I'm mainly just scrutinising for things that could be that 1% better, but I lost track of time playing on this one.. My love affair with P90s grows ever deeper.
#teletuesday

To quote the person in my workshop today, listening to me test playing this; "wow man, that's EXACTLY what a guitar should sound like"

With just one vintage scatterwound P90 on the bridge side of centre. It's very hard to find a bad sound in this guitar.

Sometimes you're limitations are what make you fantastic ‚ù§Ô∏è
I'm a big fan of walnut these days. Very excited to have a few commissions with it coming in the following months. It's a lovely wood.

I'm not quite at the final level of finish on this, hence the smudges and small lines on the body left over from earlier oil layers that I'll buff out before the final layer. But this guitar is looking so good. I think this might be one of my best oil finishes yet.

#wenge
#moarguitars

Making a bone nut.

#moarguitars
Video of this guy in action in my bio. The unique combination of P90 and passive piezo sounds absolutely incredible, check it out for yourself!

I haven't been able to ship this guitar since completeting it a month or so ago, as its owner has been traveling, and then this corona thing happened (shipping is back to normal now though!) So rather then just let the guitar collect dust I've been adding layers oil most days, to pull abit more out of the grain, and frankly I think it's starting to look rediculous.

I realised that lately I've been posting quite finished looking guitars, and less about the process. To be honest it's a bit scary, and makes me feel a bit vulnerable, showing what happens behind the scenes of a workshop. There's always mistakes, stuff to sand out, problems to solve, and mess. Lots of mess.
So I thought I should face my fears by showing one of these mistakes (or rather "design through process" ) on this hollow P bass I'm currently working on.

I like deep arm cuts on all my instruments, so I gave this guy the same treatment, but oh snap, I accidentally carved into the position where the bridge is going.

So one of my apprentices spent today carving a piece of bubinga (to match the fretboard) to act as a spacer between the curved body and the bridge. We will come up with a nice shape for it tomorrow to turn it into a design feature. It'll probably end up being the thing that I like the most about this build. It's often the f*~kups that end up being a projects best feature!

OK so who wants one of these?

#moarwayfair

This hollow #pbass I'm currently working on needs me to hold onto it to stop it from floating away.

#firstworldbassplayerproblems

#teletuesday kinda.

Single P90, single volume, with a push-pull for engaging a tone cap to darken the sound.
This is a great example of one of my base price builds, get in touch if you're interested in commissioning your own!
My hands hate it, my tools hate it, my nose hates it, but I love it, and you all seem to as well!

Oh go on then. ‚ù§Ô∏è #moarguitars

p.s. I'm taking extra luthier points for matching the cavity cover to the bubinga neck.

First Wayfair bass is starting to look quite serious!

#wayfairbass

First ever official #mortytuesday

I drank more tea then I would normally to celebrate.

I also played this guitar for a little while.

Shipping this to @dannygoldfarb in New York in the following days.

Can you think of anything better to cheer you up during the corona crisis then recieving one of these in the mail?

#moarmorty

This one I kinda wanted to keep for myself.

6 way switch from @nsfxfreeway giving you all the pickup combinations you would ever want (and possibly a few extra)

Awkward demonstration of a perfect neck joint.

This perfect fit is the key to my clean neck joints. If they didn't fit so well I wouldn't be able to have such little material around the joint, and I would need to do something basic, like use screws or something üòè

This perfect fit also makes for a more resonant guitar, that sustains for days.

@eivormusic doing what she does best, back when it was allowed to do it in public, with her Wayfair.

I miss the good old days!

Looking through some old builds of mine, and I really didn't spend enough time with this one. The soldiering iron was still hot when @alandublon landed in Copenhagen to collect it.

I think I only have about 4 photos of the build üòï

Can someone else order an Ash Wayfair built to the same specs so I can maybe have a day or so with it before it gets collected or shipped? Please?

#moarwayfair
#moarguitars

Did you know that all my guitars and basses come with stainless steel frets as standard, included in the base price?
It's a great feeling to know that every instrument leaving my workshop will always have perfect frets, even after years worth of hard playing!

This is going to be quite a nice build.

One piece mahogany set neck S type, with a bubinga neck and wenge fretboard (with compound radius) firebird style pickups, 3 way toggle and universal volume and tone controls.

Gonna rip.

Want me to make you something like this?

All orders made via my newly launched website come with a 10% discount this weekend!

Check it out! Link in bio

#wayfairbass
#moarguitarsforever

I plan on having @hayneseffects commissioned Wayfair strung up this week. Absolutely can't wait to hear it.

I just need to get a black trem tip and its all together.

It's been a fantastic new challenge to try to make a big batch of guitars for the first time (alongside all my regular orders). The fourteen Naked Morty orders have been really taking their toll on my sanity. Making jigs, taking measurements for what I want to be the "correct" shape to use as a standard, getting hold of 14 sets of strap pins, trying (and mostly failing) to utilise my cnc machine a little moar, just making sure the right fretboard is set aside for the right body wood. Simple things become more of a challenge at greater scale. 
I sneaked into the workshop today to try to catch up a little and I finally feel like I've finally broken the back of the work for the Naked Mortys. Almost all the woodwork is done. S**T I cant wait to show you all!

I'm also very excited to do some sort of a tone test for 14 guitars, made with similar pickups (all scatter hand wound by yours truly)but with different woods and pup locations. Gonna be interesting.

#moarguitarsforever

NM 1.

#nakedguitarsarebetterguitars
#moarguitarsforever

This Wayfair has reached the optimal number of finishing coats  and will be buffed, polished and assembled tomorrow! Exciting stuff!

Jazzmaster trem and a set of P90s on an all mahogany build. This one will be hard to say goodbye to.
#moarstopdoorstops

Did a quick mock up of this walnut Wayfair, to help get an idea for the the firebird pickups and bridge positioning, checking heights and alignment. 

I'm very excited to play it, it's incredibly well balanced this guitar. I love the density/ weight / hardness ratio of walnut, its really growing into being one of my favourite woods go work with.

Another mock up from from yesterday. This time a walnut custom Morty, with bubinga neck and fretboard. Firebird bridge and P90 neck. Will have the pup selector switch and volume and tone knobs mounted to the tortoise scratch plate sheets.

It's really gorgeous in the flesh!

Shipped these two beauties on Friday.

It doesn't get any easier saying goodbye to instruments. Especially when they are travelling half way across the world. It's a weird feeling. But at the same time I know it's arguably the most important part of the process! 

I can take solace in knowing all my builds go to fantastic owners, most of whom, are now friends of mine ‚ù§Ô∏è

It's Morty Monday!

This guitar got a spiritual cousin today, @astivihad from @demolizerthrash came to my workshop to hang, try guitars and ordered the first ever Moar Explorer, and I gave him the honour of naming the model, the ExMoarer.

All wenge build, explorer inspired shape, single hot wound humbucker bridge, wound by me, with a few little tricks up its sleeve. Should be done around November.

Very excited to get this build started!

Gathering momentum on the batch of 14 naked Mortys, all the necks are roughed out, fretboards are radiused and slotted and bodies are cut and carved.

It's just a matter of getting everything together now, sanding so they are ready for applying finish, frets, winding the pickups, doing the electics, making the bone nuts, set ups and assembly and then done! Phew! 

Exciting times!

My neck joints are tight like a tiger.

#donttrythisathome

Since my first guitar build I've always eyeballed the side dot markers, rather then measuring them to be exactly in line with each other.

It's actually a deliberate thing, and something I quite enjoy about my builds. I like that the player is reminded that they are playing a handmade guitar, with all its own quirks, each time they look down at the neck. I see it as a little secret that I share with all my guitars owners.

Looking back over the past few months builds for throwback Thursday and ended up getting stuck on this one.

I really really liked this build, it started my very intense love affair with walnut, and it started my (slightly less intense) relationship with @onkelamplified, as the guitar is now his, and since then I have recieved a custom amp from him, and an awesome valve powered reverb pedal he built. 

I've been commissioned to make a few moar of these later on in the year, and I really can't wait.
Thank god its Friday.

Now I know this doesn't look like much, in comparison to wafer thin Wayfairs, bound F holes, super unique, one of a kind pickup covers, reverse headstock all wenge basses etc, BUT getting (stainless steel!) frets in the first of the naked Mortys, thus moving on from the initial wood work, from the first batch of them, feels like a big achievement.

Just 8 weeks ago I put out a video I filmed, literally minutes after coming up with this idea, to try to make batches of guitars aimed at a lower price point where the key difference between them and my higher end customs, was a quite limited range of options in what you got, and that they came "Naked", meaning without any finish applied.

I had a huge amount of interest, getting I think 8 ordered the first day, and a following 6 orders in the next few days, meaning a batch of 14 guitars had to be made!

With a background as a totally hand made, one at a time, no expense spared style luthier, where it is totally justifiable, and financially viable, to spend 2 days just carving a guitars curves, to trying to make 14 bodies, necks and fretboards at a time, when the margins are super tight, has been a real challenge. Especially in keeping up the quality. But I feel like I've managed it.

I think the first 5 or 6 will be finished in around 2 weeks, with the rest just a week behind (due to problems related to stock mainly)

#nakedguitarsarebetterguitars
#moarguitarsforever
#moarmorty

Wayfair no. 1

A lot has changed in my process and design since making @beers_and_dogs 's Wayfair (it didn't even have that name when I made it)

I remember it took months and months to make as I was designing as I went, and figuring out the process as each new challenge arose.

This build has a very important place in my heart, as does Julian, aka @beers_and_dogs, for  commissioning me to make it, trusting me, and giving me the time and creative freedom to just do my thing at such an early time in my luthier journey. 

I've also always had at least one order for a Wayfair in my books since ‚ù§Ô∏è

#moarguitars

Making dust whilst radiusing a rosewood fretboard by hand for a naked Morty.

My fianc√© came to hang out and help sand guitars (Mortys!) yesterday at the workshop, and took some photos of me whilst I was putting some frets in a neck.

If you like the pictures check out her profile, she's a (extremely talented) visual arstist, and just set up a new Instagram page @_djuur_ I get an update every time she gets a new follower at the moment ( "OH MY GOD LOVE, I'VE GOT 95 FOLLOWERS NOW!!" etc etc) so I know it would  really make her day if you checked out what she's up to.

Naked Morty number 1 is almost at the finish line, with lots and lots on the way just behind. 

This one is @tristian__lee 's as he was the first to order one, I recieved a deposit from him just minutes after posting my initial video for the Naked Mortys.

Ash body, mahogany neck, rosewood board and a P90 neck side of centre.

Naked Morty No. 2 for Benjamin Jones, aka @letterpress_mechanic

Mahogany body and neck with an ebony fretboard. P90 neck.

5.2lbs in weight, and possibly my cleanest neck joint yet.

Naked Morty No 3 for Carl Blackwood, aka @carl_blackwood_

Ash body, maple neck and ebony board. Gunned P90, its gonna rip.

STRATURDAY (KINDA!)

I'm currently working on two identical commissions to this guitar, albeit one with gold hardware, and one left hander.

The Freeway 6 way switch on this guitar looks like a regular 3 way toggle, but actually has 6 positions, allowing for 6 pickup configurations.

This guitar has neck, neck and middle out of phase, middle, middle and bridge out of phase, bridge, and finally bridge and neck together, in phase. So it's got all the tones of a strat, plus one extra. 

Swipe for @eivormusic playing this guitar live in Helsinki from late last year.

A bit of late night problem solving to close off the week. Almost feels pointless leaving the workshop after 11 at night when I'll be back here by 6.30 in the morning!

But I love it ‚ù§Ô∏è

I promised myself I would make all the naked Mortys to the same specs (apart from a few wood choices and pup locations) but turns out my knees go weak when someone whispers "hey man, how much extra do I have to pay to make my morty a 29" baritone?" How could anyone resist?

So here is NM #4, with a 29" scale length, ash body, maple neck and wenge fretboard.

The mix of a P90 and a passive piezo circuit on this guitar gives loads of possible tones. From a crunchy blues lead, to totally clean, bell like, single notes, to campfire acoustic, it's got em all.

There's a demo up on youtube (search Moar Wayfair for it)

It's also for sale to the right buyer, if you're interested write me a DM!

It weighs 2.5kgs, and that's with locking tuners, stainless steel frets and an ebony fretboard on a maple neck.

This build for @ay_thebariman got finished today. Unfortunately I wasn't able to take any moar photos of it when it was done, with strings, tuners etc. 

Do you know why?

It sounded too good to grab my camera. I'm sacrificing a better post today for the sake of my playing joy earlier on in the afternoon. On this day I'm choosing extra moments of tonal bliss over post likes. 

Firebird bridge, P90 neck might be my new favourite.

First 2 Naked Mortys out the door today!

Here's what you get in the case ‚ù§Ô∏è

As cool as it would have been to take a photo of all 14 guitars next to each other when they were completed, I think in terms of keeping the quality as high as my other builds, I need to separate the batch into smaller quantities for shipping.

This means I can spend a whole day or two on each guitar, if needed, to make sure the nut, frets, action, intonation, neck relief, electronics, pickup height, pole heights are all exactly where I want them. I couldn't deal with doing that in 14 guitars at the same time!

Not to toot my own horn, but this one is a new high in terms of the sounds coming from my guitars.

Thick, warm yet articulate neck p90 and a glassy, cutting and tight firebird bridge. It's a beast!

I've gotten really into nuts lately (try saying that with a straight face)

A few years ago I was reading a book on Spanish Guitar luthiery and I came across some evidence that suggested scalloped nuts produce slightly better resonance and sustain. The argument is that there is less material in the nut to dampen the string vibration, and that the nut vibrates more readily (as it takes less enegery to make it vibrate)

I've been meaning to try it for years, but not had the time, or a good test guitar to try it.

This naked morty batch was a perfect platform for experimenting as I have so many identical/similar builds on at the moment. So I could easily compare a scalloped to a non scalloped nut on guitars with otherwise identical woods, body shapes and neck carves. 

So I tried one out and was amazed at the difference. Noticeably more volume coming from the headstock area with the scalloped nut, and a more lively feeling neck (in terms of vibration)

So I'm gonna do my nuts like this from now on.

Plus it looks really cool.

The ever lovely Al and Kasper from @culturedguitarist decided I deserved moar time to talk about my guitars, so invited me back for a second part to last weeks podcast.

This one gets much more geeky then the last. We talk about truss rods, neck joints, @onkelamplified having magic ears, nuts, naked mortys and much much more. 

Go to their profile for the link, or swipe up in my story.

I've already taken a few deposits for batch 2 of the naked mortys. I'm gonna advertise for it officially tomorrow, but if you know you're interested in getting in on the next batch write me a DM for details üòé

#nakedmorty
#moarguitars

Right then so Naked Morty batch 2!

I'm doing it again, a small run of similar guitars, based around a lower price point then my commissions, but with the same attention to detail, fretjobs, handwound pickups etc as my regular builds. Catch is, they come naked, so you have to apply your own finish (a bottle of finishing oil is included in the sale)

Naked Morty batch 2 is a little different from the first. 

It is 2 p90s wound to your taste, volume, tone and pickup selector switch. Mahogany body and neck and your choice of ebony or rosewood fretboard. Stainless Steel medium jumbo frets, 12" fretboard radius, 25.5" scale length and a 42mm nut width.

1600USD shipped to your front door in a hardcase.

To secure the spot I need 400usd as a deposit via PayPal

This is a smaller run then the first, just 7 guitars, and I've already gotten 2 reserved, so there's just spots left (at the time of writing)

The last batch sold out in 3 days, so if you're interested get in touch! 

Monthly/weekly payment options are available.

Built time will be around 3 months. 

Prices do not include VAT so if you're inside the EU I will (unfortunately) have to add 25% to the price, and if you're outside the EU you may be charged import duties!

I'm extremely excited about this (not so) Naked Morty that @carl_blackwood is finishing. Its an amazing experience seeing something I put so much time, love and care into being treated so well in someone else's hands.

I'm also excited about naked morty batch 2! In the two days since announcing it I've sold all but 2 of the 7 spots, so if you're interested in ordering one get in touch!

Details are as follows;

Naked Morty batch 2 is a little different from the first. 

It is 2 p90s wound to your taste, volume, tone and pickup selector switch. Mahogany body and neck and your choice of ebony or rosewood fretboard. Stainless Steel medium jumbo frets, 12" fretboard radius, 25.5" scale length and a 42mm nut width.

1600USD (or your local currencies equivalent) shipped to your front door in a hardcase.

To secure the spot I need 400usd as a deposit via PayPal

Your back would love for you to own this guitar.

2.5kgs, or 5.5lbs, of warm p90 tones, and a passive piezo added to cut through any mix.

It's the only stock guitar I currently have, and it's ready to ship.

Some serious tone, groove and playing from @carl_blackwood_ with his inked naked morty.

Straight into the front of a Marshall jtm50, and reverb from the room.

I love this.

Check out Carl's band @bendt__ and his profile for moar of his awesome playing!

Custom Moar Morty, walnut body, bubinga neck and fretboard. Firebird bridge and p90 neck, both with Alnico 5s, wound by me.

Signal chain after the guitar is all @onkelamplified

Using his Space Ape pedal for drive and reverb, and his 40Moar amp for clean, warm sounds.

So much tone and feeling in this small rig.

Sometimes you just need some good old fashioned Wayfair porn, know what I mean?

This build is actually more or less done now, strung up under tension, etc, I've just not had a chance to take a more recent photo of it. It should be done in the next week or so, with glamour shots, and hopefully a short video to show it off!

This one is gonna rip.

@wmfleming showing his excellent taste by commissioning this tone machine.

I felt like I deserved a treat today at the workshop, so I assembled this reverse headstock wenge Wayfair bass.

I wound 3 mini rail humbuckers for this commission, and covered them with heavily modified brass p90 dog ear covers.

I also received a warm, round, classic sounding geranium boost from @expressofx and its magic in a box.

Demo for both the bass and the pedal as soon as I can!

This one is on a UPS delivery van, and should he arriving at its new owners at some point today.

I'm very sad to no longer have this guitar in the workshop, as I loved it, but thankfully have some extremely cool builds in the pipeline to keep my mind off of all the insane tones this morty has inside it.

Another naked morty about to leave the workshop.

This Mahogany body is gonna pop like crazy when it gets its first coat of oil. I'm a bit jealous that @darne_doofy is gonna get to be the man go apply it!

Sometimes I handwind really nice pickups, and I ship them in really nice boxes, to really nice people. 

For example, today I shipped this humbucker sized p90 to @jon_roman11

#tbt

Hollow wenge Wayfair bass, that's getting a set of bass humbuckers and a passive piezo circuit. I'm also trying out a new 2x2 headstock shape. 

It currently weighs in at 2.9kgs, so should be somewhere around the 3.4kg mark when done.

I've finally got a #straturday post!

A very tastefull order from @wmfleming, of a set neck S type, built around a one piece mahogany body, wenge neck and fretboard. Lots of great tone coming from 2 single coil voiced mini humbuckers.

All going well it'll be strung up by this time next week.

It's always a great feeling when a guitars new owner takes better photos of it then I did!

Thanks @ay_thebariman for the order, the trust, the photos, the idea behind the commission and the great music you're going to create on this thing!

#moarguitarsforever
Evolution of sharpness

I just realised I didn't post @carl_blackwood_ 's finished naked morty, and that's got to be a crime.

So cool to see what other guys are doing with these guitars!

And now for something completely different! 

A rose inlay from the 3rd to 5h fret and a dahlia from the 12th to 15th for @bot_xiv 's wayfair commission.

The inlays are based on photographs Sof sent me of flowers from her grandparents garden. They were really supportive of her musical development, so she wanted to commemorate them in her Wayfair.

Feels crazy that I'm in Copenhagen, putting inlays based on flowers from an Australian garden, into a fretboard that's from an African tree!

The more I do this guitar building stuff the more uses I find for a sharp knife. For example a few years, and many builds ago, I would have used a half round rasp to get the profile from the back of the headstock to the neck perfect, but a knife does the job much quicker, with cleaner results, and I think gives you more control.

2 moar naked Mortys got finished today. Both of them identical in woods, with mahogany neck and bodies, and an ebony fretboard. But one has a neck p90, the other has a bridge p90 .

I really like the mahogany mortys. They are extremely light!
It's Friday and I'm hacking up hardware.

#mortytuesday

Some very cool commissions in their final stages these days!

One of the cool things about Moar (in my opinion) is that I'm happy to take on pretty much anything, as long as the idea excites me, and I feel like it would make sense for me to do it. People often write asking if I can do a certain thing, or some kind of pickups, a specific wood combination etc, and the answer is pretty much always yes.

So far no two of my builds have been built to identical specs.

I wound this today, it's a very faithful recreation of a 1961 Gibson PAF humbucker, with 7.5k output, 2 maple spacers, long legs on the mount, etc BUT with my own foil cover, whilst still allowing adjustment of the pole pieces.

Fiddly, but worth it.

(that's what she said)

Fingerprints will be wiped off before it's mounted to its guitar!
